title: Italian tyre maker Pirelli in difficult return to stock market
description:
(4 Oct 2017) Italian tyre maker Pirelli had a difficult return to the stock market on Wednesday, two years after a takeover by the Chinese firm ChemChina. 
Pirelli’s shares opened low after it launched an IPO (initial price offering) of 6.5 euros (7.6 US dollars) per share.
Finance expert Raffaele Oriani said the negative performance on the first day of trading coincided with an overall negative trading day on the Italian stock exchange, and stressed that conditions exist for a good long run performance of the stock.
Pirelli’s comeback on the Italian stock exchange is one of the largest IPOs in Europe this year and Oriani said this will improve the liquidity of the Italian stock market and attract investors
Later in the day, the shares stabilised at around minus two percent.
